resources.string: Send SMS via the MyNetFone API
MyNetFone Username: (To login to the portal)
MyNetFone Password: (To login to the portal)

This is a program that uses the MyNetFone( https://www.mynetfone.com.au/ ) MyText SMS API (available at https://www.mynetfone.com.au/Residential/Home-Phone/MyNetFone-VoIP/features/MyText-SMS/API) to send SMSs through the user\'s MyNetFone SMS service.
You need to be a MyNetFone Customer in order to use this program. Find out more at https://www.mynetfone.com.au/Residential/Home-Phone/Plans
Contact me via my web-site http://portablejim.now.im if you have any questions, comments, complaints, suggestions, donations, etc.
MyNetFone is a registered trademark of My Net Fone Limited
Here is more info about each field
To - the destination number, or multiple numbers separated by a comma, i.e. 04xxxxxx, 04xxxxxx. For international numbers, please use E.164 format. i.e. +[country code][number]
Message - the text message to send. Only the first 160 characters will be sent.
MyNetFone Username - your MyNetFone username, as used to log onto the MyAccount portal, e.g. bob_smith_31415
MyNetFone Password - your MyNetFone password, as used to log onto the MyAccount Portal
SMS subscription ID - SMS Subscription id, as per the MyAccount Portal. To find out your subscription ID, Log in to the account portal and go into MyTextSMS => SMS service => SMS Subscription ID.

Format phone numbers correctly - Formats the phone numbers to an acceptable form (i.e. turning "9999–9999" into "99999999"). This works for some formats of phone numbers. You can always edit the number if it is wrong.
"Cancel" button - Discard changes and return to the main screen
"Save" button - Save changes and return to the main screen

Just a friendly reminder that this program has help

Hit the menu button on your phone, then click "Help".

(this message will not pop up again)
